item.title: The sociology of personal life
item.itunes:author: AQA
item.itunes:subtitle: Assessment differences and co-teaching ideas
item.itunes:summary: The sociology of personal life is relevant to the Families and households topic - an optional topic on both the new AS and A-level specifications. In this podcast we’ll give you an overview of the Sociology of personal life and some guidance on delivering this area of study to your students.

item.title: Globalisation in sociology
item.itunes:author: AQA
item.itunes:subtitle: An overview of globalisation throughout our AS and A-level
item.itunes:summary: We'll give you an overview of globalisation, and ideas on how you could deliver it to your students.

item.title: Bringing the schemes of work to life - delivery of positivism and interpretivism
item.itunes:author: AQA
item.itunes:subtitle: Explore our schemes of work in depth
item.itunes:summary: We’ll focus on using the schemes of work to deliver outstanding sociology lessons, in particular how you can engage your students with positivism and interpretivism.

item.title: An overview of the new AS and A-level Sociology specifications
item.itunes:author: AQA
item.itunes:subtitle: Prepare to teach our sociology specifications
item.itunes:summary: In this podcast, we’ll talk you through our specifications, our resources and provide you with information on some of the new content and assessment.
